column4: Anyone know how to make ubuntu detect a mybook external hard drive?
plug it in then do dmesg|tail, see if it is detected
http://pastebin.com/mb298f70
possible solution http://kerneltrap.org/node/2963
I'm not sure what I'm looking for on that page
it's all there, I don't know what more you want, second comment onward
insmod sbp2 sbp2_max_speed=1 returns "insmod: can't read 'sbp2': No such file or directory
try this http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=6631&highlight=isnmod+spb2
how would I update the modules? (after editing the file)
if you look at man modules it might become clear
all I could come across what update-modules, which is deprecated
/etc/modules is read at boot
yeah, I got that, was hoping there was a way to avoid that :p
there probably is, I don't know it offhand, would a reboot kill you?
nah, I'm going to in a few minutes, making sure I put the line in right.
I think that solved the firewire part, any idea how I'd know if the external is connected?
plug it in and dmesg|tail again
http://pastebin.com/d26d91fe0
that looks like the same error to me
I'd put together a forum post at this point, probably cross post to that one I linked you earlier
yeah I noticed it after the pastebin ;x does the line "sbp2 serialize=1" need to be put in the /etc/modules any certain way? I added a new line for it.
I'd guess at least with the underscore, should be good to copy and paste from that post
hmm, I put the line below the sbp2 module itself, I'm going to try it with deleting that line I put in and put serialize=1 after the module and see if it makes a difference
sorry, don't really know much more, been flying blind til now
